intro: Chamaemelum mixtum, commonly known as yarrow, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its flat, composite flower heads that resemble small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features feathery, aromatic leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Yarrow is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils, and it has been used historically for its medicinal properties.
